text: I’ve never had a pest control company come out and spray/inspect my house before so I wasn't sure what all to expect. A tech named Jason came out and was extremely professional and friendly. He actually cared about what he does and he wanted to do a good job. Even the lady scheduling my appointment was extremely sweet and great to talk to. When I first talked to Dave I told him of some of my concerns about the bugs around my house and I wanted to get all this stuff done. He told me that I probably didn’t need a bunch of stuff that a good inspection and spraying would more then likely solve my issues and I wouldn’t spend near as much money. I then realized that Dave wasn’t in this just to “make a sale” he wanted to give me the service I needed not sell me a bunch of stuff I didn’t need. Good people. I would recommend this service to anybody. It’s hard to find a company that wants to help solve your problems and create a friendly relationship with you more then they want to cash your check. Dave’s is there to help and their employees seem to be genuine good hearted people.

I have never come across a company with such amazing and understanding customer service. Bob is the nicest! I just had to come and leave a review after that experience today. I was totally blown away and expecting service to be suspended and a ton of late fees.

If you’re looking for a company that treats you like they would your own family while also providing great services (we have not had a termite problem at all)... this is the one.

name: Lorraine Price
text:
Sid came and listened to the issues we were experiencing regarding ants and mice indoors. He went back to his truck, grabbed the sprayer, and sprayed every crack and all along the walls near the floor. He quickly put together glue traps for the mice, and we discussed where to place them. We had fire ants in the yard, and we already had a bag of granules for that purpose, so he graciously used a hand-held spreader to disperse it around the house. He also sprayed outside the perimeter of the house to kill and deter insects from entering the premises. It all took less than an hour. Very friendly and professional. Great service!
Warning! Make sure that you have adequate ventilation. We had all of the windows closed and the a/c running. The smell lingered for hours. I got a very bad headache from staying in the house inhaling those chemicals.

I think we made the right choice and if you call the Tuscaloosa Orkin I believe you will too.

text: Michael, Doug and Tina were all very friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Michael did an inspection and got everything setup. Doug came out and took his time handling our belongings and explaining what he was doing, why and what we needed to do between monthly services. Tina was very friendly when I called to make our payment. Although she was just getting in the office, she went ahead and took my payment information since I would be unavailable when she was going to be able to enter all the details into my file. Super happy with our choice to go with this company for our pest control needs.

name: Leighann Hayes
text: The Tuscaloosa Office has been very helpful to us. Tina in the office is very great and sweet. Michael came out and talked to us very thoroughly and we are very pleased to be in business with this branch! 😀

text: We’ve been super pleased with the service we’ve gotten from Michael Gaddy and Doug. The treatment has knocked the bugs back so much we’ve actually been able to enjoy our back yard! We had a terrible wasp problem where I didn’t feel safe to sit outside and now our family can spend all day out without worry! 10/10 Recommend

name: Edward Richardson
text: They have a 2 month guarantee on all their services and work. We had to literally beg 3 times to get services rendered on our house where the previous treatments had failed. One of the 3 times the service technician, who had a appointment scheduled for 9 a.m., finally decided to show up at 2 p.m. after I called him 3 times asking him if he was still coming. They only gave me back $50 of the $300 I spent on the company. They would not stand by their guarantee. Stay away from this company especially if you live in the Tuscaloosa, AL area. *Update * 10 days after I canceled my account 250 of the 300 that was spent was refunded back to me. This was after a very nasty argument with the lady that answers the phone in the Tuscaloosa, AL office. She absolutely refused to give the gaurenteed refund back. She claimed to be a manager, but when I talked with the actual manager we then got things straightened out. Stay away from this company especially if you live in Tuscaloosa, Alabama.

name: Amanda White
text: Our experience with the Tuscaloosa team has been great. They explained all our options, gave a fair price and service has been awesome.

name: Michelle Richardson
text: DO NOT RECOMMEND!! when we first called they made all these guarantees to us and they wouldntake care of us and the first visit was 250 bc they come out and find the root of the source and start there. Well the first visit is all they did was spray like any other day and put out traps then said they would be back in a week. A week went by and we never heard from them so we called and they said no its 2 weeks not one, something about giving the females time to drop the eggs, so we waited and after 3 weeks finally got an appt set up, but the guy was a no show and when we called he said he would be here in 30 mins, a few hrs went by and he said he is on his way, waited an hour and called the 800 number. After that he was at our house within a few minutes and when he left my card was charged 50.00. (Anytime they come back before your monthly treatments, it is free) so we called and they said they went ahead and charged our next month. Well the guy was supposed to come out the following week and bomb the house so we made plans for the animals to be gone and guess what they never showed up. So we called and got all kinds of excuses and finally 3 days later they came which meant we once again had to make arrangements for our pets. After evacuating for 4 hours we came back to air out the house and there were still bugs on our ceilings and walls that were very much alive, plus the drain flies were still here. We called and cancelled our service and went with another company. Well they have a 60 day guarantee or all of your money back, it has only been 45 days and they only agreed to reimburse the 50.00, so I called the 800 number and they said the local office manager would call me back the next day and its been 2 days and I still haven't heard from them. This is the Tuscaloosa office. I will say when I lived in MS the service there was great, but here it is HORRIBLE!! DONT LET THEM FOOL YOU!!

name: City Shakers Evangelistic Church (The Prophetic Voice)
text: Jerry is the man he always take care our hotel- we have not been haven complaints since he been spraying the facility He is a great kind heart man who always speaks good about the company Orkin- he seems like he should be a owner because he takes pride in what he does. He tells me all the time if we need anything let the company or him know. Please tell him we are excited about his service here.. I will also contact corporate they need to know what a great guy employee to have. In this day and age its hard to come across good folks to work. Jerry is the guy!! please send our thanks!!! its because of him we are happy to have Orkin to serve our hotel

text: I live in an older home, so quality pest control is extremely important. I am impressed with Orkin's exceptional customer service and dedication, and would recommend them to anyone. Their technicians are skilled and professional, and deliver excellent results.

text: Orkin in Tuscaloosa is amazing. I use this service for my home and you definitely get what you pay for. I never have any issues but if I do I know the owner will get them taken care of. I highly recommend.

name: Melanie Conway
text: Due to the weather, living on a corner lot and having multiple animals that like to go outside. I felt like I was being taken over by fleas!! I had done all I possibly could by using flea pills, collars, drops and even frequent baths but after calling Orkin- getting house sprayed and outside areas sprayed simply put No More Problems!!! Thank You ORKIN TUSCALOOSA 😁😁😁

text: Orkin had the contract where I am employed, really good at what they do.  Michael Gaddy is awesome.

text: Michael Gaddy has been so helpful . He is very knowledgeable and professional. I will recommend to everyone.

name: Julia D
text:
So far so good. I just started with them a week ago and I have not seen any more pests.  I didn't give a 5 star because they are supposed to seal cracks and ensure barriers are good. I know there were areas that needed attention. He didn't do that,  but I have not seen any pests either.

This is an edit of my review above 10 months into the service contract. Call someone else. The service is absolutely horrible.  I've never experienced anything like this in my entire life.  During this month, I've had to call the tech back out due to issues.  I have not had to do this in the first 9 months of the contractual term. But, this is free with your contract.  However when I called,  no one showed up.  I called again very politely  and no one came. Finally,  a week later I called the 1 800 customer service line and someone came.  Again, this same month I began to have problems with fleas due to my neighbors dog who is practically a straw.  He tries to sleep on my porch and often lounges into yard. They did come once, but when I asked for follow up--- in person, the secretary mentioned that my service was 10 days away anyway.  No ma'am.  My 4 year old son is getting bit by fleas. I need the tech now. Despite this, I'm sitting here 3 days later and no call or visit. WTH. Orkin is actually more expensive than some other national chains. If you are in Tuscaloosa save the head ache. Call someone else.

text: Willing to fit schedule

text: Mike "Jr" came to my home promptly and did a wonderful job.  He was very knowledgeable and shared many resolutions and information with me.  He was extremely professional and did a very thorough job.  Love to do business with this awesome coming.  Shout out to the secretary!!

name: Keith Brittain
text: Called and Mike had an immediate opening due to a cancellation. Said he would be here at 2 PM (+/- 5 min) and said if he was going to be late he would call. Dead on time and explained what the pest were.  Told me the price and process.  Said next trip to empty cabinets because the needed to be treated. Said if i could empty by morning he would return at 9 and go ahead and treat now.  As promised, Mike showed up promptly at nine treated the cabinets, told me to wait 45 minutes to an hour then I could put everything back. In this day and age that kind of customer service does not need to be unappreciated so this raving review is for somebody who tells you they’re going to do something and does exactly what they say. Second of that, three days since the treatment, and the infestation has been curved considerably. Instead of saying 8 to 10 roaches a day, I find more and more that have died, and less and less moving around.  I very highly recommend Mike Adams for your pest-control needs. The a pitta me of customer service, responsiveness, and punctuality. Most importantly, results!

text: Whiley Hamilton was very understanding about the bugs I HAD and he is all about his word he is a family bussiness and his crew were great and he charged alot less than any of the other exterminators I contacted.And his successful business is the best in my opinion.

name: Jeffrey Wydner
text: I have been an Ecopest customer since September of 2019. I rarely ever give reviews but my experience with Ecopest has been so positive that I wanted to share with others. The company has proven to be honest, thorough, and professional on all aspects. They have not tried to sell me packages I do not need as many pest control companies do. They are small enough to make the relationship personal yet big enough to handle the job. I highly recommend Ecopest to anyone needing pest control.

name: Sherri Mann
text: I first learned of Ecopest through Groupon.  They were very nice and happy to treat our home and yard for the first few visits.  I had concerns about lack of communication and technicians not showing up on time, but was not convinced that services should be suspended until the last visit in March 2020 when the check I gave the tech for payment was "lost."  We waited several weeks to see if they could find the missing check before paying by credit card.  We asked them to cancel all services at that point.  Two months later, Ecopest cashed the missing check without contacting us at all.  We called and left messages but our calls were not returned.  I emailed them and asked for a $75 refund.  I got a response the next day that said that Michael would process a refund check shortly.  They never bothered to call or apologize for their mistake or try to explain their actions. I would not recommend this company.

name: Michelle Stinnett
text: As a realtor, it's great to have a company you can work with that understands our needs.  Dustin is great.  The company is affordable and very knowledgeable.  I love working with Stephanie when I need to call and get info.  She's very helpful!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Shawn Masters
text:
This review is strictly about the lawn care side of the business. This company is not dependable, they make all kinds of excuses and they do AWFUL work. Charge a hefty amount ($50.00) to cut and ($35.00) to treat and I have a very small yard as I have a large in-ground pool that takes up most of my back yard. My grass looked the worst, this year, it has ever looked and they broke an electrical box on my pool and then tried to make it out to be my fault. If you want to have a good-looking lawn look elsewhere.

***Update 5 Jan 2020***

Received a phone call on 4 Jan from one of the owners (Dusty, he managers the pest control). He wanted to see what he could do to make up for the awful service that I received from the lawn care part of his business. I told him there really was nothing he could do as I am not one to write a review just to get a discount. He was very nice and offered to refund part of my money but I told him that he did not need to do that. He was concerned about my review being one star as it really hurts the other side of his business as they are tied together. I told him i understood and that I hated for that to happen so I have now raised it to a three-star rating. I cannot speak for his side of the business so it is unfair for me to give the entire business a one star because of the lawn care side. So, with all that said I still do not recommend the lawn care part of this business or at least not until Dusty gets rid of his partner whoever he is. Thanks for reaching out Dusty it really speaks volumes about your business ethic.

resp.text: Shawn, I will be reaching out to you to see what needs to be done to make this right.  It is our goal to always do the right thing when it come to how we treat people.  I know mistakes happen sometimes.  It important that when they do, we take ownership of it.  I apologise for not achieving and exceededing your expectations.  I will call you soon.

name: joey williams
text: Completely blown away by the customer service that Ecopest offers. Went above and beyond for us. We will be using them for all of our future pest control needs and will be dropping Cooks. First rate service. Great pricing. Very very impressed!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.  It is our pleasure to serve.

name: Lynn Smith
text: Beware!!! Horrible company. They sold us on their good reviews but their service is hardly top notch. From day one they were not able to get our account right. We were being charged for services that we did not sign up for and were not preformed. Had to call every quarter when our bill was due because it was always incorrect and instead of fixing the issue all we got were excuses then Dustin would try to sell me additional services that we did not need nor want. We were being charged late fees when our account clearly showed  no balance due. Save yourself time and money - there are too many pest control companies out there so don’t settle for less here.

resp.text: Lynn I'm sorry you had a bad experience.  I tried looking up your account to contact you, but we do not have one listed under this name.  It sounds like a clerical issue.  Should be easily fixable.  I would love the opportunity to make this right.  Please call 2562741716 on Monday, we open at 9am.  I will make sure it gets fixed.

Dustin has always spent plenty of time with us to explain what was or will be done and why. Each of those guys are friendly, we'll mannered and professional. I chose Ecopest over the more "well known" company's because of the price yes; but more so, because of their personable approach and willingness to provide the best product for the lowest amount in the friendliest manner. Not fake, just fact.

text: We had the pleasure of having the owner come to our house. We have a bad problem and he was very thorough in explaining things to us. text:
We had a wonderful experience with Ecopest. They are very professional and did a great job with our yard! We would definitely recommend them to those seeking lawn care.

Amy Hood
Decatur, Al

resp.text: Thank you Amy.  It makes me happy that you had a wonderful experience.

name: Julie W
text: I was in need of a true crawl space analysis after having a large amount of water (35000 gallons) dump into the crawl space after a pipe break.  First I called one of the crawl space companies.  Issue with them is that they actually don't care about anything except making sure you get a quote for about 4000 to 8000 dollars in water proofing nor will they give you a report with the details of the moisture readings.  My agent called Ecopest and Dustin came out to do an inspection.  He did moisture readings throughout the crawl space and recommended a series of steps to return the crawl space back to its usual condition.  He explained everything in simple terms and I learned a lot from him.  When the work that needs to be done isn't something they do he recommends highly capable people with the same integrity as those that work at Ecopest.  This job ended up costing $4000 LESS than the supposed crawl space experts and now my crawl space is back in its original condition with no waterproofing solution necessary.  Thank you Dustin!  You are a lifesaver!

resp.text: It is our pleasure to serve.  Thank you for the kind words.

name: Susan Seavers
text: We have been using EcoPest for several months. I could not be happier with the service. We have been able to sit outside & not continuously wave bugs away. It's very economic, considering I'm no longer spending money on candles, sprays, etc. Wonderful, professional Service people too.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.

text: So far, so good. The owner, Michael, came out within two hours of me contacting him. He THOROUGHLY inspected the inside and outside of my home, including the attic, in search of the rat/squirrel/or whatever it is I heard scurrying around in the attic the night before. He placed traps all over the attic, and sealed EVERY opening he could find outside. The best part of the experience was the professionalism and the price. The price was AWESOME. He'll be back next week to check on the traps that were placed in the attic. I'll keep you all updated.

text: Great experience with Peskies. Michael was nice and informative. Will continue to use!

name: Derek Dean
text:
We'd been having several issues with wasp, stink bugs, and roaches - some interior and exterior.

I got a recommendation from a friend to try Peskies, he highly recommended their services.

My wife spoke with them first: they were thorough, asked what problems we were having, accepted pictures we'd taken of different bugs, and informative about their 1st visit process.
During the visit, they were knowledgeable about the pest problems we were having, thorough in explaining how their process would fix our issues, and very friendly & professional.

We recommend them for your pest control needs, and plan to use them going forward.
Also, their pricing was fair.

*Photo was taking the morning after our first exterior treatment - this made my wife extremely happy!

name: Teresa Wang
text: Michael from Peskies Pest Control responded very promptly and came out to our house the next day after contact. He was easy to communicate with and very thorough in everything he did. We were also very appreciative that he wore a mask and shoe covers the whole time. Highly recommended!

text: Michael is very professional. Addressed all my concerns. I would highly recommend him for all pest control services.

name: Rhonna W Phillips
text:
Michael, the owner and inspector, was very responsive to my inquiry and communicated really well.  He was informative without sales pressure.  He's the first person I've met who is passionate about the bug/critter business.  This business is a supplement to his EMT Firefighter job.  Seems like an honorable guy running an honorable business.  He responded to questions and was even accommodating to my special requests to see the contract in a form that was readable.  Imagine that!  The $ fees for install of a start up of Sentricom Termite bait stations were half of the more recognizable named companies' fees.  And he includes double the inspections to monitor and keep our homes and outbuilding structures secure.  Charlie, the installer, was also polite and professional, punctual and communicated well.  The install went fast and was nonintrusive.  Only negative was, I am not a fan of having the bait station housings flanking my home entrances.  It's a small issue, but an esthetic one.  I know the system requires training and standards for installs so this might not have been preventible.

May 24 2021 Addendum:  So this business is remarkable!  The owner is set on running his business with a mission that every customer is completely happy.  I have to say I was more than impressed when my prior review prompted him to contact me.  He offered to and came by and relocated the bait stations I wasn't esthetically pleased with.  These days to find a business where they work hard, are ethical, really aim to please, do what they say they are going to do and do the job well seems so rare.  It deserves an honorable mention.  I'm a fan of Peskies!

name: Mary Bancroft
text:
Wow!! Long but worth while great review ahead! What a great “non-business” exchange I was blessed with! I have read so many reviews and always personally feel like it may be friends or family. What I want to promise, is I am neither.
Here’s my story!
I was leaving church last night with both of my children and a truck got behind me. Not following too close or being impatient. But the headlights on the truck were literally almost blinding.
I allowed the truck to pass and enlisted help from my 6 year old and called the number listed on the side of the truck. It was late so I left a voicemail explaining what I experienced and there was no need for a call back.

I just thought the business owner would want to know! And pleasantly surprised, I got a call back and we played phone tag.
When we were able to speak he was kind, understanding and personable about my silly complaint. Told me the reason for it and that it was resolved.

I don’t own a home, he didn’t take this time because I was profitable for him. Mike took the time because he seems to have a genuine care for others.

***not family, not a friend
***please support mike in his endeavors!!!

.

text: I am very glad I called peskies, so far they have been great and im extremely pleased with my results this far from the work they have done and look forward to continuing to work with them for years to come!

text: We had a great experience with Peskie’s. We were having issues with mice getting into our basement. He sealed all possible sources of entry and provided traps. We no longer have an issue! We now use Peskie’s for all of our quarterly pest control and termite services.

name: Lesley Howard
text: We have our quarterly pest control service and termite bond through Peskies. Peskies offers professional, effective service provided by a quality, family-oriented small business owner. Thanks for keeping our home critter-free and considering children and family pets in your treatment offerings. Five stars!

name: Drew Kempton
text: Got a few quotes and inspections for mice removal prior to Peskies. One thing I noticed was I had to nearly coax the other companies to come inside to find where these things were getting in. All other companies only wanted to set traps or block entry from the outside. In fact this method had already failed with a previous company and I made sure the others knew this too. Mike voluntarily requested to come inside. And after I checked to see how things were going, he had all my large appliances pulled from the walls and found the exact spots they were entering. Nobofy else did that. Sold! He plugged those holes up, set interior and exterior box traps, and is going to provide service throughout the year as needed. Woo boy was I impressed! Very professional, wore mask, and after a month I had yet to see or catch a mouse which previously was a weekly occurance. Cannot recomend his service enough!

name: Vern Swindell
text: We were having issues with another company and decided to give Peskies a try. Very pleased with how quick Michael was able to come to our house and the results. We’ve used them for a little over a year now and glad we made the switch. We have now switched to Peskies for our termite inspections as well. Highly recommend them!

Mike not only did his job but he went the extra mile to make sure my home is protected from termites. I was so pleased that I had him do my Mother-In-Law’s home also.  I do normally recommend folks, but I strongly recommend giving Peskies a call for all of your pest control needs.

name: Raven Law
text: Michael came to my apartment today to help me out with a mice problem that I’m having and he was great! He was very helpful and honest! I would definitely recommend him and he came out on short notice!

text: I met Michael today and was very pleased with his professionalism and  knowledge. He arrived when said he would and answered all my questions to my satisfaction. I'd highly recommend Peskies!

text: Michael is the absolute best. Very responsive, and most importantly, he knows his bugs!

name: Dawn Atleecarter
text: Mike is awesome. He was able to come out, quickly and thoroughly assess my issues and come up with a treatment plan. He provided information on the safety and efficacy of the products he used and also provided pointers for preventing issues in the future. I highly recommend having him out of you have an issue.

name: Stephanie May
text: Michael and his staff  are very professional and great to work with!!! The service they provided was very thorough and the product works great!

name: Mike L
text:
I saw Peskies advertised at Piggly Wiggly and hired Michael to come spray my mom's house.  He came about three hours early because of some cancelations by other customers.  Our problem has been waterbug/cockroaches, teeny biting flies, and mosquitoes.  He sprayed the entire house inside and out as well as gave us tips to reduce moisture and natural greenery bridges giving pests easy access to the house.  We never were told that by any other exterminator and we've had a serious mosquito problem as long as I can remember.  He also pointed out the pears that we let fall from the tree and rot were feasts for mosquitoes and roaches.  We even had holes in some of the wood panels of the house that we were unaware of, that were caused by carpenter bees which he killed!

On top of all this about thirty minutes after he left the roaches started to come out.  Two to be exact.  The spray got them and they seemed to be on their last leg.

The man is thorough 10/10, informative 10/10, and professional 10/10.  I can't say enough and I would highly recommend Peskies.

name: AC Flurry
text: I have used Peskies regularly since it opened and have been extremely satisfied with every aspect of each visit. The value, services provided and professionalism are all present and appreciated. Highly recommended from a satisfied client.

name: Andrew Russell
text: You will not be disappointed!!!! I just switched to these guys for termite control and that is what this review is about. Mike was very thorough in his inspection. He showed up on time, and inspected every inch of my home inside and out. He found stuff that my previous company never did!! I really like the fact that the guy you deal with here(Mike).....is also the owner. The fact that I know I can call him directly on his cell for assistance, rather than speaking to a different customer service person In another state every time you call one of those big companies, is huge for me. Family owned and operated business that I highly recommend. He will do a better job than the big company’s like Wayne’s, for the same price or cheaper, and give you WAY better customer service. Mike is also a firefighter which is freakin awesome. He is clearly a man that wants to help others and that is what he will do for you whether it’s termites, bugs, or fist fightin an outta control domestic house fire. Mike is a man and will do you right. Highly highly recommend!!!!

text: From our first phone conversation, Michael was extremely friendly and informative about what he offered. He gave us the most thorough inspection I’ve ever had by a pest control company. He took down all the spider webs and dirt dobber nests on our property. When I called other pest control companies to see if they could do this, none of them were sure they could. Michael was prepared for any issue we might have and had the knowledge of how to fix it. Highly recommend!

text: The technician contacted us by phone at about 8:00 a.m. wanting to comer that morning to do our pest control service. No advance appointment was made. This has happened before and I asked for an advance notice in the future. I told him it could not be done that morning, as we were going out. Again, i insisted on an advanced appointment. He made one for next week. At about 9:00 a.m. while sitting at a restaurant, I get a notice from our home security system that there was motion at the front door. It was the Orkin tech, treating our front porch. The gate to the back of the house and the doors to the garage and storage building were locked, so he could not treat the back of the house and those areas. I will immediately cancel my contract with Orkin. Also, it seems that they do very little for the cost. I could do the same with commercially available products.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about this issue. We strive to be the best and we didn’t achieve that with your account. Please accept our sincere apologies. We would love to have an opportunity to make this up to you. Our service manager will be reaching out today.

text: A year ago I was happy with Orion’s services but I need to update that review because aspects of the service has changed. They used to call me and schedule an appointment for inspections but now they show up. This last termite inspection I was not home - we have a poultry farm with free range poultry and our birds are protected with a perimeter fence around the property. We have a gate you must drive through and it is kept closed most of the time. It is important for me to be home to monitor the gate and the animals so they don’t get out into the street. So if people show up without scheduling an appointment that is a problem. I have been told the change is with the central office not the local service technicians.

name: Clair Hogan
text:
My experience with Orkin has been one of the poorest imaginable.

I began service with orkin last year due to a major sugar ant issue I was struggling with in my kitchen despite having placed any sugary items inside of ziplock bags and attempting to attack them myself.
Upon the first appointment the company was very easily able to accommodate my difficult work schedule and had someone available in my area that Saturday.
The associate was very professional, explained everything he was doing and left me feeling as if we had made the right choice. We found out he was on call that weekend and would not be our regular exterminator, however.
After a few weeks we discovered some ants dying off and the trails in the kitchen lightened but only because they had began to invade my bathroom that was on the other side of the kitchen wall. So we called to request another visit. As it turned out the flexibility I was promised when I called for service information was not very flexible so we had to wait some time to be serviced when I would be home.
This time my bathroom was serviced and same as before, the ants pushed back over to my kitchen.
The same game of cat and mouse, they ran back and forth as opposed to killing them off.... which became even more stressful because now I was paying someone to take care of an issue and was not getting results.

But what was even more infuriating was that I received an email one day while I was at work saying that my house had just been serviced.
I’m sure this was the outside portion of my house that was serviced but what about the inside where I STILL had ants crawling around everywhere even though I had already spent a pretty penny to get rid of them?! They didn’t so much as even give me a courtesy call to say they would be coming by my house nor did they leave a slip of confirmation on my porch so that I would know they had physically been on my property (sorry, an email can not confirm that).
So my sugar ant problem continued.
Frustrated, I found a DIY trick to clear ants.
I was at work AGAIN and received an email that my house had been serviced while nobody was home. Without a courtesy call stating someone would be servicing my house. Without any confirming papers left at my residence so I would know they had physically been at my property.
What about the inside of my house? I hadn’t even reported to Orkin that I cleared my ant issue at this point so wouldn’t they need to be able to service me where they’d have access to the inside?
I called customer service immediately and explained my frustrations and how I would like to cancel services because I don’t even know if someone is actually stopping by my house because nobody is ever home when they come and we are never aware that someone is coming unless we pre-schedule it not to mention they didn’t get rid of my problem.
Services were canceled.
I was told the local branch manager in Huntsville, Eric Westmoreland, would be contacting me but never did. A few weeks later I received a bill.
So, I called customer service again to get information on why I was being billed but was told they couldn’t answer me and that they would send a message to have someone from my local company contact me. Nobody did. I received ANOTHER bill from them. So this time I called the local branch to express my frustrations.
It was a Friday about 3:45pm and the girl I spoke with said she could not answer me regarding why I was being billed but her manager could. She indicated her manager had already left for the weekend but assured me she would take note down and have “Eric” contact me first thing Monday morning. Monday came and went without a call and to date I haven’t been contacted by anyone. Orkin sent my bill to collections after this without once being willing to talk to me about the issue at hand. I have paid it for the sake of my own name. But the lack of professionalism in this company is appalling.
I’ve spent my whole working carrier in customer relations and management and at no point have I EVER known of a manager to be so dismissive to paying customers.

text: Let me start by saying I’m a repeat customer from (2012) so it was an easy decision to return to Orkin for my pest control concerns. He was extremely knowledgeable and efficient in treating my residence both inside and out. After treating my residence I spoke with Kierra and was given an awesome welcome from Orkin. Kierra was very polite and courteous during our telephone conversation. I have no complaints and will recommend Orkin to both friends and family.

name: Dana Parcher
text: I bought their one time service, which had a 30 day guarantee, meaning they would come back if I saw any other pests. Regardless though, the technician said he wanted to come back at the end of the 30 days. I thought this was going to be great, and at first it was. They give great service on their first visit. While he didn't show up right during the scheduled time frame, he was close. The poison was strong, and I was pleased. However, for the second appointment, the office was unorganized. I scheduled an appointment and the technician called on the wrong day to ask if I was home. For the actual appointment day, I waited at home for hours for him to arrive without a show. I called him and he not only denied my call, but never called me back. Since it was the end of the day, I called the office the next day and arranged the visit for the same day. He asked to come out in the next 30 minutes, which was little time for me to get off work, but I did so because I was nervous I wouldn't get him again. I ran home, only to be stuck waiting again. He was another 30 minutes late. This time, he didn't even spray, just put down more traps. All that waiting and for what? The "guarantee" was such a waste of time, in my opinion. However, like I said, the first visit was good and the technician was nice, it just seems as if there was some great misunderstandings, organizational, and timeliness issues, especially with the repeated visits, which I found frustrating. I am not sure I will continue my service.

resp.text: I am sorry you didn't find our services exceptional. We are now under new management and will be reaching out to see how we can improve and earn your trust back.

text: I just called and met Nathan today--yes they came out the same day! Both men were very kind and knowledgeable. We've only lived here a couple of months and apparently the house was still occupied--ya know what I mean😲. I totally nagged Charles as he worked but he responded very graciously and patiently even as I followed him everywhere he went. I would have given 5 stars just for that alone but I will wait to update my rate and review in 10 days when/if I see results.

resp.text: Thank you so much!We really appreciate when our customers give us positive feedback like this! I hope you we can exceed your expectations on our 10 day follow up!

name: HALEY HOLDEN
text: My husband and I suspected that we had bed bugs in our home from a recent trip to New York. We called terminix and they did a poor inspection of our home and said yes, we had bed bugs and it would cost over $2,000 and we would need to wash every piece of clothing and bedding in our house. We wanted a second opinion and had heard Heritage Pest Management had a bed bug sniffing dog. We called them and were so pleased that they were able to come out that day. They were on-time, very professional and did a detailed search of our beds and couch looking for any signs of bed bugs. Their dog sniffed all of the rooms in our house and did not find any bed bugs. We can not thank Nathan enough for going above and beyond by driving from Boaz to Birmingham and being so honest. He will be our first call for any bug issues in the future!

resp.text: Mrs. Holden we greatly appreciate your kind words! We really strive to be honest and upfront with all of our customers and we look forward to getting started on your normal service!

text: Mosquito Joe has been treating my yard for the last 2 seasons. They have always shown up at appointed time. Treatment is effective. I have not been bitten once by a mosquito so far this season. The Mosquito Joe Team

name: Matthew Wilson
text: Great company, friendly staff and it actually works!!! I’m on my 4th spray and I can sit outside and enjoy my yard and let my dogs play and not worry about being carried away with the Alabama mosquitoes!!! We also had a huge issue with fleas due to living in a wooded area and this has eliminated the problem!!! Our pets have 0 fleas and are on no flea medicine! We have also not had any tick issues like we normally would have during summer months! We are completely satisfied with our service and think it’s a great service and will continue using Mosquito Joes!!!! Definitely recommend!!!! Great job Mosquito Joe!

resp.text:
Thanks so much, Matthew! We appreciate your recommendation and we're glad to hear that you and your pets can enjoy your yard without fear of attack! We've got you and your furry friends covered so that fleas and ticks don't. We will see you again soon!
The Mosquito Joe Team

The Mosquito Joe Team

The Mosquito Joe Team

name: Charles Alexander
text: We used these guys for the first time this past summer.  I have to say I was doubtful at first, but let me tell you it was an awesome experience.  We literally had not been able to sit outside in the summer months for years because of the mosquitoes and gnats.  After the very first application, we had chairs outside enjoying the weather again.  Everyone has been a pleasure to work with, from Carol in the office to PJ, the technician that serviced our property.  I will most definitely be contacting them again this and recommend them to anyone else.  Thanks again.  Chris Alexander

resp.text:
You are very welcome, Charles! Thank you for sharing your review and your kind words about Carol and PJ, we think they are wonderful as well! We love to hear that you're happy with our services because a yard is a terrible thing to waste!
The Mosquito Joe Team

name: Jeffrey Brown
text: Brandon is so polite and has so much knowledge! My yard has been mosquito free ever since I've started using Mosquito Joe and I can finally sit outside without having to get chased back inside by mosquitoes! Thank you Mosquito Joe for making outside fun again!

name: Mike Perkins
text: Let me start with saying my kids are allergic to mosquitos. This is the second company we have used for mosquito control and Mosquito Joe is far superior in every aspect of the service. From the actual working of the product, to the amazing customer service we received from contacting the office to the actual technician doing the spraying. This is the second season now with them and they sent us Dillon this season. He does an amazing job, very professional and will answer any questions we have about the product. We will be requesting the company to have him spray our property every time. Thanks Dillion and Mosquito Joes.

resp.text:
Mike, we love hearing that we've been able to keep you and your kiddos safe from mosquito bites, as we know how important that is with allergies! Thank you so much for your kind words, and we'll be sure to let Dillon know he's doing an awesome job. If you think of any further questions, please let us know. We're happy to help.
The Mosquito Joe Team

name: John Tice
text: We started the service in March, 2020. Since then, we’ve noticed the spray time has been gradually decreasing. As a result, our mosquito population spiked. I reached out to the company and the problem was immediately corrected.

The Mosquito Joe Team

text: After using Mosquito Joe all last season for our yard, my wife informed me that she considers it just as critical of a service as our home pest control. And yes, I agree. Of course, that means more to my wife than me, because when she was in the yard with me, they never got near me anyway.  (My blood must comparatively taste bad.) No more mosquitos! That also meant more friends sharing our yard with us, until COVID-19 hit.

resp.text:
Grant, thank you for your kind words! We love hearing that we've kept you and your wife from getting eaten alive this summer, and we hope you've still been able to enjoy your yard during these uncertain times. We look forward to working with you again.
The Mosquito Joe Team

name: James Briggs
text:
I Just got off the phone with Owner Tim, and let me say, this individual had to be the Rudest (So-Called) "Professional" I've spoken to in such a long time I cannot remember and being the Owner, I am in disbelief that he actually had the audacity to refer me to his competition when all I did was ask a simple question I was told to ask by another professional (The Bug Doctor), whom we decided not to go with due to the fact that they are relocating.   He was downright cruel and crude. I would have been a first time customer with them and when we commit to a company, we usually remain with said companies for Life (Directv, Nealco, Verizon Wireless, Ford Motor Company (All of our vehicles), etc.   We are the type whom are Christian, dedicated, caring & Kind customers to those who treat us the way we treat them therefore, we took HIS advice and went to His competition (Not the Bug Doctor BTW) who treated us with the UpMost Respect we Deserve Immediately after a tragedy (We lost my Dad a few weeks ago & Noted this to him but he could care less!)!
I wish there was an option of rating in the Negative because I would have rated them a Negative -3* -!!!
There is NO Excuse to treat Anyone the way he did, & for what it's worth, when I stated I was a U.S. Marine, he laughed at me!!
I wish Anyone who decides to trust this man with their home a Lot of luck because if !!! ~ If Everyonme were to feel as though My family feels about this company right Now, Where would the aforementioned company be Tomorrow ~ !!!   Right!!= Out of Business! Enough Said & again, DO take serious caution when trusting your Home with This company!

resp.text:
James,

I am very sorry if I came off as rude, that was the furthest from my intention.
I wish we could have come up with a resolution that suited you over the phone.
We take client satisfaction very seriously and want to make sure everyone that does business with us comes away with a good feeling.  There may have been some miscommunication on my part but I assure you we are very big proponents of the U.S. Armed Forces and would never ever laugh about someone's service.   We have been very big on hiring Veteran's and we even work with several local people that help with various causes for Veterans and they can tell you that we have always been supportive in whatever way possible.
After talking for quite some time I felt it would probably be best if you were to work with another company, however, I do not make those suggestions lightly, and it was done out of the best interest for your situation.
I look to work with all of our customers and if any issues arise to make sure they get the best possible outcome and encourage our customers to ask for me personally if they feel they have been mistreated or misunderstood.

We wish you and your family the best moving forward.

name: Daniel Glassco
text: Tim and the folks at Sand Mountain Pest Management have my highest recommendation for any and all Pest control services you may require.... They are very knowledgeable, courteous and always on time... This Veteran is proud to be a patron of Sand Mountain Pest Management  and proud to call Tim  and many of his staff friends! SMPM has sponsored several  Jimmy Harris VFW Post fundraisers which benefited many Marshall County Veterans! Give the fine folks at SMPM a call, you will be glad you did! Tell them Gunny sent you! 🇺🇸 STSCS(SS) Dan H. Glassco (USN Ret.)

resp.text:
Thanks Gunny !!

Appreciate you and your family for the sacrifices you have made for the service !!
Appreciate your support and business !!

text: Arrow Exterminators provided excellent service. The sales rep spent time with me answering questions about all aspects of the termite treatments and the inside pest control problem. name: Quattro Cat
text: Arrow took over our previous service provider, Knockout Pest, without any disruption of service. Arrow provides the same great quality of service that we got from Knockout and we are extremely pleased with them. Arrow is always prompt in notifying us that our quarterly pest or biannual termite service is due, and the scheduling via email option is very helpful for people like us who lead busy lives. Arrow's techs have all been absolutely the best - clean (they always put on shoe covers when they come in the house), quick, and thorough (I just had my quarterly pest control visit and I was shocked by the amount of time the tech spent and how he went over every inch of the areas he serviced). I highly recommend Arrow Exterminators.

resp.text: Laura Ann, thank you so much for taking the time to leave this excellent review. We truly appreciate your business and hope you have a wonderful day!

name: Darla Meeks
text:
Extreme rudeness.  I have used them since 2014 on my two homes, and three businesses.  I am not sure what has happened over the past 3 years, but their service and kindness has deteriorated so bad that I can hardly believe they are still in business.   They are VERY unorganized in their accounting department which is frustrating, but an even more significant issue is that they messed the outside of my home up by drilling holes all over my brick home to place screens and charged $3,320 to keep squirrels out of my attic.  The manager informed me that a new rep had done the work.  No joke!  Of course, the squirrels continued to get in my attic and Arrow never did a thing about it.  I called them out MANY times.  My husband was catching them himself with a large trap in the attic, and this service was supposed to be guaranteed.  A total waste of $3,320 and a damaged home was what they gave me.  We forgave them and tried to move forward, because that is what the Lord would want us to do.  That was the first real issue, but since then, (that was June of 2017), I have been even more appalled.  They are extremely rude, and could care less whether they keep your business or not.  The latest issue: we paid for a termite bond updating it every year for one of my businesses in particular.  The contract was signed 1/13/15.  I cancelled my monthly services with them in November due to their rudeness.  I called today to get a copy of my termite bond knowing it will need to be renewed with the new pest control company.  The manager tried to tell me that I cancelled ALL SERVICES  back in November.  Why would I have cancelled a termite bond that I had already paid and it did not renew until 1/14/2020?
They have lost their minds.  I have found a new pest control company for my two homes and all three of my businesses.  I hate to write bad reviews, but I also hate for someone to receive the horrific service that we have.  I would never ever treat my customers like this.

resp.text: Hello Darla, we're sorry to hear this. Your 100% satisfaction is our number one priority. If you could send us your phone number or contact information we will have our upper management team contact you right away. Thank you.

name: Keith Dixon
text: Have used Arrow for years. Both for residential and commercial.  Noticed at our home one day that the termite traps or whatever they are we’re all dig up and gone. I call them they said we were behind on the bill. I said I didn’t see a bill. No call or anything. Put our home at risk without even contacting us. Said it would be $230 for them to come reinsert them. I said ok. The guy shows up and says. I have bad news for you. It’s now $1000 to do a termite bond. Which we had already. Very poor customer service. I have more but will let it go. I do not recommend using them. I will be closing all accounts residential and commercial over such a small issue that could not be taken care of.  Not smart for a business.

resp.text: Hi Keith, your 100% satisfaction is our number one priority. We're sorry to hear this and have forwarded your review to our management team to follow up. Thank you for contacting us.

name: Linds LivingMagically
text:
Valley Pest Control should be shut down. My parents have used their services for at least 15 years, the last time they came out they smashed multiple pieces of duct work during their inspection. They admitted to this too. They are literally the only people who go underneath my parents home. When my mother, who is know a widow now, called the office to ask about getting the duct work fixed the main guy there said “well I’m not doing anything about that” and hung up on her.
Taking advantage of the elderly and especially someone who’s been a loyal customer for years is sickening. Now my mother is looking at $1,200 worth of repair on the duct work these idiots destroyed. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

name: Brandi Williams
text: Valley Pest Control seems affordable and like the obvious pick, but the company does not provide a termite bond that covers repairs, and they are careful not to mention that when you sign their contract. Their "bond" only covers retreatment. If you find yourself in a situation where the termite treatment you paid for has failed, you don't want the company that failed to keep termites out re-treating your house anyway. You want a company that assures you they can keep your home protected and are willing to back that with a guarantee to repair damages. I recommend finding any other company.

name: theresa B
text: We recently bought a new home and the previous owners had been using valley pest control and had already paid through August, so we figured we would just stick with them. First we had issues just getting them to send us the contract. After  calling them 3 or 4 times we finally got the contract but the wording was odd and we were confused by a couple things so we called to ask them a few questions. No one is ever in that can answer a question. They promise a call back but we never got one. I even emailed them but never got a reply that way either. Over the period of 2 weeks we probably tried to get a hold of someone 6 or 7 times and never got to talk to anyone who could help us.  As to the actual pest control at the home, we have wasps INSIDE the storm door arm hinge cylinder thing and late at night my husband said he keeps hearing skittering in the attic. This is after them doing an 'inspection' before we bought the home. We couldn't be there that day so cant say for sure they actually came, or if they did if they actually looked around. They obviously don't care about keeping accounts. This would have been an easy account for them to keep but because they have 0 customer service they lost us and hopefully anyone reading this thinking of using them. I'm going to look around and maybe use a smaller company, someone that appreciates customers and can help and answer questions if we need them. At this point if we needed them to come out and take care of pests I have no confidence that they would come out.

name: Nick Black
text:
We have pest control service as well as a termite bond with this company. We took it over from the purchase of our home. We have called in numerous times. Sometimes we get someone on the line but usually not. No one ever calls back. We have to call in again. The termite bond language is imprecise and sounds like they distinguish between a repair bond and just treating if termite activity is detected. We have the Sentricon system and are actually paid three more months in advance. No one has contacted us about continued treatments since we bought the house.

This is my sixth house. I have a lot of experience and in different regions with dealing with pest control companies. I have never seen this lack of attention to a customer. It isn't about money. We are willing to pay for service we just cannot get a proper phone call back.

Going with someone else.

name: Kathy Miller

Nathan is always friendly however the office staff is very unorganized and unprofessional!! I called last week to check cause we were 2 weeks over due. No return call notta call again monday morning she said when would you like to schedule? I was like can you tell me why they've not been out very short told me shed look into amd call me back about 1 nathan shows up... No notice no call etc.
If im montly then every 4 weeks or so i should be on schedule and that's not how they seem to work
After 6 months of service we cancelled because our issue got worse not better!!!
Beware

name: Mike & Stephanie Freeman
text:
We first called the company “Critter Capture” and had them come out to get rid of a squirrel that had made his nest in our gutter. After checking our attic and seeing that the squirrel had not yet made an entrance into our house, they told us there was nothing they could do.  The guy didn’t even have a ladder to check our gutters!

So we call Jim from Exclusive Wildlife & Pest Control.  He laughed when I told him the previous encounter with the Critter Capture company and then proceeded to get his ladder (that he brought himself!) and take a look at our gutters and ensure that the squirrel had not damaged our roof yet and also took the time to double check our attic. No damage was noted except for the fire pit cover we caught the squirrel tearing up the previous weekend.

Jim gave me two options on how to get rid of our furry new houseguest; we could capture him alive and release him elsewhere or set a trap similar to a rat trap that should kill him instantly. After much discussion my husband and I decided on the rat trap since the evenings here have been very cold and the poor squirrel may freeze to death in a live trap. Jim was so very patient as we weighed our options and was able to give me the pros and cons on both methods.

After one failed attempt to trap him (the trap caught his tail instead of his neck) Jim text me throughout the evening to reassure me that he would get him the next day and that all would be OK. Jim returned promptly the next morning, set the trap again and was able to get the squirrel instantly. He disposed of everything and cleaned the nest out of the gutter.

Jim was so very pleasant to work with I will definitely be calling again if any other squirrel decides to make his home here!
I would recommend Jim and Exclusive Wildlife to anyone who is looking for good, quality, and prompt service.

Thank you Jim!

resp.text: Thank you Mike & Stephanie Freeman, it was my pleasure helping you rid your home of your unwelcomed guest and it was nice meeting you.

name: v Coffey
text: ATEC provides termite service to four houses I own.  I was short on cash so asked them to wait to provide service later this year after I saved the cash.  They convinced me to make payments, and let them do the service in March.  I post-dated checks and gave them to ATEC to hold/deposit at the first of each month for four months.  Last month they deposited a check 2 weeks early, before my paycheck to cover the check was in my checking account.  I caught this because I routinely check my accounts.  They said it was an oversight and it would not happen again.  I just checked my checking account and the check that I post-dated for 5/1/14 was cashed on 4/21/14, and again my pay will not be auto-deposited until this Friday.  I live by my word and people can trust what I say to be true, and I only do business with people and companies that I can trust in return.  I do not trust ATEC to do what they say.  As with all/most termite service companies, I have paid them many hundreds of dollars up front to provide bonding, so I am in a quandary.  But I will figure out a way to provide my business to a company I trust, and I recommend others do the same.

name: Jay Graham
text: I had the unusual problem of yellow jackets building a nest inside the walls of my mother’s house. After calling many exterminators in the area, and being turned away without any guidance, I happened upon Mosquito Joe’s website and gave them a call. After describing the issue, Gale and her husband took it upon themselves to personally come out and take care of our problem! They were both extremely professional and very friendly and understanding. After fully explaining everything to me, they went through the process of exterminating our nuisance and even came back the next day, free of charge, when concerns arose over the sheer amount of yellow jackets flying around (and dying!!). Ultimately, everything happened exactly the way they said it would and, within 72 hours, my mother’s home is yellow jacket free!! I highly recommend their service and will check with them first on any future issues!! Thank you so much!!

resp.text:
You are welcome, Jay. We're glad that you found us so that we could come help! It's great that scheduling was seamless. We won't let any nesting yellow jackets move into your mother's house, and your kind words made our day! Thank you for your amazing review. We're here to help if you need us again.
The Mosquito Joe Team

Can anyone guess what happened? The inspector never showed, that’s right! I am done with these guys. The folks that actually come out and do the spraying are great, the inspectors seem to be irresponsible and inconsiderate of your time. Look somewhere else.

name: Abby Rogers
text:
I transferred to Terminix pest control services, because I was unsatisfied with my previous pest control service. One of my biggest complaints with the other service was that they didn’t seem concerned with our pest problems and put forth minimal effort in addressing our concerns and pest issues.

Not so with Terminix. So far, every person we’ve dealt with has been knowledgeable, attentive, and very thorough in the work they’ve done. Some have gone above and beyond to provide stellar customer service. They take my concerns seriously and take the time to fully explain issues. I’m so thankful we have Terminix and feel so much more at ease knowing I have a team of experts, who actually want to do a good job, there to help when it comes to pest control. With a three-year-old and ten-month-old in the house, this is huge.

And for anyone who has balked at getting their Exclusion Service because of the price, it is worth every penny. They have blown me away with their thoroughness and how willing they are to go the extra mile and problem solve to make every inch of the house as inaccessible to pests as possible. I highly recommend this service, and I highly recommend Terminix.

Call #2: (to the new number given above). Asked if local and says no... at the call center AGAIN. Requested to be transferred, and notified this is not possible (first person should’ve said so).

Will try another company with more upfront info and ability to speak to a local agent, especially as their online info is FALSE!

text: Stephen came to our home on 8/5. He was on time, courteous and thorough. He even pointed out a plumbing leak in our crawlspace that we were unaware of. Stephen is an exemplary example of what a Terminix technician should be and I highly recommend him and this companies services.

name: L W
text:
Completely unresponsive to complaints and requests!  Decent final result.

I contacted Terminex to inspect my wet crawlspace and replace my broken sump pump.  They came promptly, were competent and reasonable in their recommendations.  I signed the contract and I thought all was good.

Then they started coming, opening my gate, and crawling under my house without any notice.
I contacted the manager, the call tree, and the inspector begging them to  only come with advance notice, so that I could ensure the pets were not let out of the backyard and that the work was done with my supervision.  No response.  No notification or scheduling.  They returned multiple more times without notice.

The final work turned out OK though.

name: Evett Turner
text:
I am actually posting for my mother, a satisfied customer..

"The gentleman that performed my last home inspection was very polite and professional. I have some reservations about Terminix annual contract fees, if there are no findings of termites the annual cost should not increase annually." L. T. Chirwa

name: Jenny Horrocks
text:
If I could give the company zero stars I would. We bought a new house a little over a year ago that was bonded against termites through terminix.  I had a terminix representative come over shortly after we moved in to talk to me about their options, and I signed a contract with them to keep my house bonded against termites.   About 6 months later I noticed that I had not gotten contacted by them for our twice a year termite check.  I called the company and found that they had no idea who I was.  They still had the address listed under the previous owners.  They figured I had just gotten a quote and not actually signed a contract.  After I scanned in and emailed a copy of the contract to the manager they apologized and explained that the employee that had signed me up had been fired - and he had never turned in my paperwork.  The manager thanked me for sending him the contract and assured me that it was all corrected in the computer.  He also sent someone out for our termite check.

Fast forward another 8 months...  I realized that it was a little over a year since we moved into our house, and again I had not heard from Terminix.  I called the company to get a very long run around. After all you can't just call the local people - all numbers go through the 800 call center.  Terminix still did not know who I was, and was calling me by the previous home owners names.  I was also told that our contract had been cancelled.  I was told the problem could only be solved through the local branch.  I waited several days to hear back from them but never got a return phone-call.  I called the call center again and they "Escalated" the problem. I asked them how long it would take to get a response and was guaranteed it would be withing a couple days.  Needless to say I still have not heard back.

Now, due to state law, I have to pay another company to dump termidor around the house in order to get bonded through someone else.  I thought Terminix, being such a well know company, would have their act together and be able to handle something as simple as a termite bond.  I am guessing that even after more than a dozen phone calls they still have no idea who I am.  Save your money and definitely go with a different company.

text: On time and communicated well.

name: Gay Wade
text: I began noticing sounds in my attic and inside my walls some time in early Jan.  I called a wildlife person and they said to call Terminex because I already have a termite contract with them.  So, they came out and a man (I think supervisor, Devon) told me the cost would be $1,400.  Lordy, I nearly fainted.  They added insulation to my attic and sprayed the insulation with a strong disinfectant that they told me was so strong, it would kill AIDS.  They also checked out all points of entry/exit and put caps over all vents.  Devon said this equipment would allow critters to get out but not to get back in.  They also set a baited trap.  Devon said they'd be back now and then to check trap.  The only times they ever came out, I had to call them.  Once, I thought something was in the trap so I called them.  Nothing was in the trap.  It's is now the end of May, and nothing has ever been in the trap.  Devon came to my house maybe twice and before he left each time, he'd say to me, "We won't leave until the last squirrel is gone."  Funny, I believe Devon was only at my house twice - seems to me that after he got the $1,400, he lost interest.  Every morning, the squirrels or whatever they are, are between the walls marching along to go outside.  Then, they return late in the afternoon and I hear them again, marching along in between my walls.  One of the critters hangs out in my office (I can hear him in there).  This weekend I dog sat for my son's dog and Stitch went straight to my office and sniffed about.  He also smelled all around at entrance to my bedroom door.  Again, at night I can hear them outside my bedroom door.  Sometimes it sounds like they are playing.  So, here I am at the end of April and short $1,400 but I still have the problem.  They wake me up when they are leaving very early in the am (when Devon told me, they'd only be able to get out of my house, not in) and I hear them return late in the afternoon.  I'm very concerned because I know they are urinating and defecating between the walls and maybe even in the attic.  Also, you can bet they are multiplying.  I just don't know what to do about this problem.  Clearly, Terminex didn't find all entrances/exits for these critters because they are still using my house as a home base and they leave and return every day.  To say I'm disappointed would be an understatement; I am very angry that after 3 months I still have the same problem.  I've wasted my time and money.  Also, scheduled appts. seem to mean nothing to these people.  First of all, they give you a range of hrs. for an appt.  (ex. 1-3) so that means you have to be home sitting around waiting for them for 2 hrs.  On 3 separate occasions, I made an appt. and they never showed nor did anyone call me to advise of some problem and to set a new time so 3 times I had to call them and tell them they didn't keep my appt. so I needed to make another appt.  Seems as though their office people (who answer the phone) could have made a simple phone call to me to let me know they couldn't make my appts.  To say that I'm angry wouldn't even begin to state how I really feel about this company!

text: I just canceled my service with Cook's after having a very awful experience with them for the past almost year or so. I know a lot of people say "I don't normally leave bad reviews on here but..." I actually don't. Anyone can see that I usually leave really good reviews, but this company has left me frustrated and when I canceled with them the guy didn't even spray the last time he came by and I know he didn't because I went outside after he left and the ground was completely dry. And to top that one off I still got charged for it... So I essentially paid the guy to come remove spiderweb and then I guess stare at my house for a few minutes and then leave because I don't know what else he did besides that. Also unlike other pest control companies I've worked with you need a contract with Cook's so that you have to stay with them even if you don't like their work and it's $40 per month and that's just to spray outside, it's an extra like $35 per month if you want them to spray inside and that's just way over charging. The company we're switching to is only $60 and that's every 3 months AND they spray inside and out. Also they require no contract though they do ask that you get on a schedule with them so that they guarantee they'll see you when you need to get your house treated. If you made it this far into this review then I'll tell you who this awesome other company is. It's LEWIS PEST CONTROL. I highly recommend Lewis, but not Cook's. Cook's disappointed me.

name: Amy L
text:
New post:
My poor review is completely contingent on poor office staff- the yard work is great when they come out, but due to the terrible phone representation who cannot make a schedule or answer a phone I am giving the company 1 Star.

Old review:
We have attempted to utilize this service for about a year. They come out inconsistently, they would call and say they would come out and not show- and it wouldn’t be just a few days later because of “rain”.  They would show weeks later unannounced so we would have to call again to ask them to come spray the backyard, after we called several times to get in the schedule in the first place.
The front office staff is atrocious, inconsiderate and extremely rude. My husbands phone number was blocked and we had to call from other phones to get the front office to even answer and then they would not schedule our service. They would claim to- but no one would ever call- this final straw came after we called several times over EIGHT WEEKS!
Do not hire this group unless you want to waste your money and be disappointed!
As far as the actual treatment goes, that was fine. I would rate one star purely based on how terrible it was to get scheduled and actually get an answer.

Update:
So we fired this company over a week ago- after we called and called, even called the Huntsville office to try to get someone at the Birmingham location to help us. (Huntsville was very responsive by the way and it turns out not related to the Birmingham office). This is what leads to my theory that either the front office blocks phone numbers or is just so lazy that she doesn’t answer the phone.
So we finally get the front desk worker on the phone and we tell her we do not want the service for the above reasons and to remove us from the quarterly rotations. The manager did try to call to confirm why we were leaving service, but we were fed up with trying to deal so we didn’t respond.
WELL this week a worker comes out, a week after we told the front desk we didn’t want service anymore,  Without a text, voicemail  or email alert and they spray our front yard AFTER WE FIRED THEM for the same dang reason!! So apparently the woman didn’t even put down that we didn’t want service and we asked to cancel our arrangement! So a worker sprayed and left a bill on our front door and a note that the back gate was locked. Of course, it was locked- we were not expecting service and had no notice service was coming because we had told the front desk worker to remove us.

Honestly, I think the whole thing could have been avoided had TurfDoctor just hired competent front office staff- the woman who seldom answers the phone, but it is ALWAYS her when she does answer cannot get her calendar straight. Please get new office staff!!

resp.text: Amy - we value all our customers and would love a chance to clear this up.  Please email us at turfdrbham@charter.net so we can get to the bottom of your issues and make it right.

name: Brian Williams
text: Beyond disappointed with this company.   Paid them for years, never got my yard completely under control.    Called this spring with issues regarding  poa annua (pre-emergents not working well because of all the rain) and instead of coming to do a service call, they charged me for one of the 8 yearly visits.  Two weeks later , poa annua still alive!  Didn’t even kill the grassy weed. Call back, supposed to wait 4 days for them to come back out , they come out and do not even enter my back yard it seems.   I know this because I have cameras around my house.   I will find another local business to take care of me , or I will do it myself.

name: Avery Wadowick
text: I signed up with terminix last October and it's been a nightmare ever since with their customer service! First they double signed me up for services so I got charged twice. That took nearly a month for them to straighten out and lots of phone calls. Then when that was finally fixed every time I have a appointment they cancel last minute or dont show up. Forcing me to call yet again. I will say their product does appear to work well. Then recently like many people we were struggling to pay our monthly bill. So I called to cancel for the time being. Found out the guy that sold us the contract lied about we could cancel when we wanted. He was since fired right after we signed up in October I found out. So having found out i was stuck in a contact I went ahead and figured out how to make the payment. Come the end of February/early march I get a notice saying my service was canceled. Even though I told then I would continue to pay and I really wanted to speak to the branch manager, after calling like 5 times in February he never called. I paid stupidity and they still canceled it ...now oits mid march and I'm still trying to sort this mess out. Long story short, AVOID THIS BRANCHS SERVICE!!! corporate level they are great but this branch is the WORST!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for bringing this to our attention, Avery. We apologize for your recent experience and would like to help you.
Please send us an e-mail at socialsupport@terminix.com including your full-service address and the phone number associated with the account or call 1-800-TERMINIX

name: The Messer Family
text: First started using Terminix they were suppose to come every week to two weeks, no one ever showed up and I kept having to call and the Terminix sprayer would change our appointments without telling us, we got a different person and the same with him, he said he would be back in a week or two because they were so bad and again no one ever showed up. I contacted the new manger who says she has us all fixed and she was so sorry and she could help us and asked me to take down the bad review ... which I did cause she was nice... so anyway...  A new guy comes and says our regular Terminix man was out due to death in the family and he wasn’t gonna spray that day just do cobwebs and let our regular guy come spray in a week... no one has shown up for weeks. I contacted the manager who gave me her number and she has yet to reply... funny how that happened after I fixed a bad review and made it sound good and now she doesn’t reply since I fixed it? Um no ma’am. Terminix is a JOKE! Very unprofessional people and tomorrow I AM CANCELING OUR CONTRACT! This is ridiculous and we should not be having this much trouble!

resp.text:
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your recent experience and would like to help you.

name: Richard Young
text:
Have two recent problems after 18 years of two types of service.  Had animals in the attic and hired Terminix to do an exclusion.  Sounded like it would be a big deal thus it was costly.  Two guys showed up, found the hole they were getting in and patched it. Took just over an hour.  Said they did not have screening they needed but would be back tomorrow. That was May 13.  Two weeks ago.  Placed a call to the territory manager that sold me on the service on 5/21/20 and he said he would talk to his boss and get back to me.  Not Yet!

Got a call to schedule a regular home service on May 16.  Got late afternoon email saying technician was on his way.  Got second text telling us he was finished and what service he performed.  He NEVER showed at our house.  My wife called on Monday 5/18/20 and after several messages and long time holding, a Donald got on a transfer call, said he was a regional manager.  Promised to get the service rescheduled.  Not Yet!

Not sure if the virus is causing them communication issues, but this service is totally unacceptable!

resp.text:
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize for your recent experience and would like to help you.
Please send us an e-mail at socialsupport@terminix.com. Listing your full-service address and the phone number associated with the account?

Price is great.

You should just choose Terminix instead of looking at other companies.  You won’t be sorry.

I would NOT use them please call around... I would check out Knox or Bug Getter their prices don't go up every year.
